answers: According to the WHO, the most common symptoms of COVID-19 are fever, tiredness, and dry cough. </newline>Some patients may have aches and pains, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat or diarrhea. These symptoms are usually mild and begin gradually. </newline>Some people become infected but don't develop any symptoms and don't feel unwell. Most people (about 80%) recover from the disease without needing special treatment.</newline>People with fever, cough and difficulty breathing should seek medical attention.
expressions: What are the symptoms of Coronavirus, COVID-19?

answers: According to the World Health Organization, Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses which may cause illness in animals or humans.</newline>In humans, coronaviruses are known to cause respiratory infections ranging from the common cold to more severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS).</newline> Around 1 out of every 6 people who gets COVID-19 becomes seriously ill and develops difficulty breathing. Older people, and those with underlying medical conditions like high blood pressure, heart disease or diabetes, are more likely to develop serious illness.
Please reach out to your manager or HR if you have any concerns related to COVID-19 and your work environment.
expressions: Who should I contact with work safety related COVID-19 concerns?
Who to contact with COVID concerns?
Who to contact with corona safety concerns?

answers: The WHO recommends four steps to help protect yourself: </newline>Wash your hands frequently, regardless of whether they appear dirty</newline>Maintain social distancing - keep at least three feet (1.5m) between yourself and other people. Particularly those who are coughing, sneezing and have a fever</newline>Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth </newline>If you have fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical care early
expressions: What can I do to protect myself?

answers: There are currently no confirmed cases of COVID-19 amongst our employees.</newline>If you're concerned that you may have been exposed, please speak with your manager and self-quarantine for 14 days.
expressions: Are there employees infected with COVID-19 within the office?

answers: Visit the World Health Organization at www.who.int for the latest news and resources.</newline>Also, check for real-time information on individual destinations/regions on our intranet site.

All existing business travel should be canceled.</newline>Please contact your local travel team by email or phone to request changes/cancellation of your travel arrangements.</newline>If you need more information or experience difficulties with contacting your travel team, please email travel.help@acme.com.
expressions: What if I already booked travel
What if I already booked travel for an upcoming trip?

answers: All business travel is suspended indefinitely.</newline>If you feel travel is essential, please speak with your manager.
expressions: What is ACME's policy on business travel during this situation?

answers: If you or a member of your household has been infected, you are not permitted to be in the office, and we advise you to self-quarantine for 14 days.
expressions: I think someone in my flat might be infected

answers: Employees are not required to be tested. However, if you or a household member have been exposed to COVID-19, please disclose this to your manager immediately and self-quarantine for 14 days.
expressions: Are employees required to get tested?
Is ACME requiring employees in affected areas to get tested?

answers: Personal travel is not restricted, however we advise you to pay close attention to country travel advisories.</newline>To ensure the safety of all AMCE employees, we are asking all employees to notify their managers or HR of any travel during the past 30 days.
expressions: What is the policy on personal travel during this situation?

answers: All upcoming live events, including StartUp, and Sales Kickoff are canceled. A full refund will be issued to anyone who registered.
Employees are prohibited from attending conferences or events (in person).</newline>Please do not register for any events that will take place before September 1st, unless otherwise notified.

Can I attend other work-related conferences?
Can I attend other work-related events?
I want to attend a conference
I want to attend an event

answers: Please arrange for meetings to be held virtually. To avoid large gatherings, in-person meetings of 4+ people are not permitted.</newline>Furthermore, all vendor meetings, trainings and certifications conducted by an outside organization must be held virtually or rescheduled for a later date.

If you have safety concerns and would prefer to work from home, employees can do so. Please speak with your manager accordingly.

answers: In most countries an image of a receipt is acceptable to submit in MyACME, therefore there is no change to the current process.</newline>In those countries where a paper copy is required, please submit scanned copies of the bills/receipts in MyACME so the reimbursement can be processed.

answers: There are no planned changes to our existing expense reimbursement process.

answers: There are no planned changes to our existing payroll process and schedules.

answers: There are no planned changes to the approval and payment process to our vendors and contractors.

answers: You should work with your manager to obtain pre-approval before making any purchases. If approved by your manager, you can submit via MyACME for an expense reimbursement.
